Movie news from The Province.</description><language>en-ca</language><copyright>Copyright (c) The Province</copyright><lastBuildDate>Tue, 03 May 2016 19:38:41 Z</lastBuildDate><category>LIST</category><category>VAPR</category><category>VAPX</category><category>N</category><category>UTF8</category><category>1</category><category relevance="100">938667</category><category relevance="100">InformTagsOnly</category><category relevance="100">entertainment</category><category relevance="100">entertainment/movie-guide/Movies - Top Stories/story.html</category><category relevance="100">movies</category><category relevance="100">Movies - Top Stories</category><generator>(c) Postmedia Network Inc.</generator><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11893832</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/local+arts/vancouver+documentary+film+festival+opens+with/11893832/story.html</link><title>Vancouver documentary film festival opens with different kind of storytelling</title><description>A chat with director John Bolton about his film Aim for the Roses</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Tue, 03 May 2016 20:53:44 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11893833.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Vancouver documentary film festival opens with different kind of storytelling" href="http://vancouversun.com/entertainment/movies/vancouver-documentary-film-festival-opens-with-different-kind-of-storytelling" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11794818</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/maze+runner+actor+dylan+brien+injured+during/11794818/story.html</link><title>Maze Runner actor Dylan O’Brien injured on B.C. set during filming</title><description>U.S. actor Dylan O&#8217;Brien is in hospital in Vancouver after being injured Thursday on the set of a sequel in the Maze Runner movie franchise, studio 20th Century Fox said in a statement. &#8220;Dylan O&#8217;Brien was injured yesterday while filming Maze Runner: The Death Cure in Vancouver, Canada,&#8221; read the statement released to American news outlets. The studio said production has been shut down while the 24-year-old O&#8217;Brien recovers.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sat, 19 Mar 2016 01:13:53 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11794819.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11794529</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/television/vancouver+shot+motive+returns+stand+alone+murder/11794529/story.html</link><title>Vancouver-shot Motive returns to stand-alone murder mysteries for final season</title><description>TV SERIES: Motive Tuesday at 10 p.m., CTV</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Fri, 18 Mar 2016 20:43:00 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11794530.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11758170</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/vancouver+morgue+cool+place+flick/11758170/story.html</link><title>Old Vancouver morgue a cool place to see a flick</title><description>OK, people aren&#8217;t literally dying to get into Vancouver&#8217;s old morgue on movie nights, but the waiting list for sold-out monthly screenings can be three times the tiny venue&#8217;s 22-seat capacity. If you want to see The Shawshank Redemption next Tuesday night at the morgue, you&#8217;re out of luck &#8212; $10 tickets to the 7 p.m. screening have been sold out for weeks.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 03 Mar 2016 02:47:08 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11758171.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11738851</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/meet+vancouver+stuntman+plays+buzzy+surprise/11738851/story.html</link><title>Meet the Vancouver stuntman who plays the buzzy surprise role in 'Deadpool'</title><description>TORONTO - Vancouver actor-stuntman Rob Hayter has found himself at the centre of online buzz for playing a "Deadpool" character he admits he'd never heard of.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Tue, 23 Feb 2016 21:36:15 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11738337.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11716597</guid><link>http://wp.me/p1JrHa-UR3</link><title>Superheroes: Anything but a Deadpool of ideas for filmmakers</title><description>We look at the enduring popularity of the legends of comic books at theatres and on TV, from Smallville to Deadpool and beyond.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sun, 14 Feb 2016 23:31:43 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11716598.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11713086</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/oscar+goes+creators+giant+inflatable+green/11713086/story.html</link><title>And the Oscar goes to: B.C. creators of giant inflatable green screen for special effects</title><description>DELTA, B.C. &#8212; As Godzilla rises from the ocean depths and attacks the Golden Gate Bridge, movie audiences suspend disbelief at the captivating on-screen spectacle.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 11 Feb 2016 21:56:26 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11713087.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11700339</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/celebrity/ryan+reynolds+doesn+think+weird+named+baby/11700339/story.html</link><title>Ryan Reynolds doesn't think it's 'weird' he named his baby daughter James</title><description>The Vancouver-born 'Deadpool' actor and wife Blake Lively named 13-month-old James in honour of his late father, James C. Reynolds.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Fri, 05 Feb 2016 18:59:08 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11700341.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11698495</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/boxing+backgrounds+help+actors+with+indie+movie/11698495/story.html</link><title>Boxing backgrounds help actors with indie movie project</title><description>Four Vancouver actors are getting together for a new indie drama inspired by their mutual boxing backgrounds. Actor-screenwriter Ben Ratner hasn&#8217;t boxed competitively since he was a teen, but the memories and the scars linger: &#8220;Dale Walters broke my nose once sparring.&#8221;</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Fri, 05 Feb 2016 01:52:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11698496.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11662701</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/child+star+melted+hearts+critics+choice+awards/11662701/story.html</link><title>The B.C. child star who melted hearts at Critics' Choice Awards was made for this: Director</title><description>The film director who first cast a nine-year-old actor from British Columbia says she's not at all surprised by Jacob Tremblay's skyrocketing success after his heart-melting acceptance speech for a Critics Choice Award became the talk of Hollywood.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Tue, 19 Jan 2016 23:53:38 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11662572.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11652700</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/meet+stunt+bear+beats+crap+dicaprio+revenant/11652700/story.html</link><title>Meet the B.C. stunt ‘bear’ who beats the crap out of Leo DiCaprio in The Revenant</title><description>From outrageous Internet rumours to being spoofed by actor Jonah Hill at the Golden Globes, the grizzly bear from The Revenant movie has become a kind of breakout star.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Mon, 18 Jan 2016 21:02:43 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11654949.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11652093</guid><link>http://blogs.theprovince.com/2016/01/14/jordan-bateman-its-time-to-wean-film-industry-off-corporate-welfare/</link><title>Jordan Bateman: It's time to wean film industry off corporate welfare</title><description>Every once in a while, you&#8217;ll see one of those faded red bumper stickers from 2013, pleading to &#8220;Save B.C. Film!&#8221; Well, mission accomplished &#8212; thanks to a Canadian dollar that has slumped below 70 cents US.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 14 Jan 2016 20:32:15 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11652099.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11632639</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/heathers+musical+keeps+tone+dark+cult+movie/11632639/story.html</link><title>Heathers: The Musical keeps tone as dark as the cult movie</title><description>Heathers, the 1988 black comedy of secondary student serial killings, wasn&#8217;t a hit. But over time, it became a massively successful cult flick and today it ranks among the best high school films of all time. In 2014, Laurence O&#8217;Keefe and Kevin Murphy debuted Heathers: The Musical off-Broadway. Wednesday night, the show has its Vancouver debut.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Wed, 06 Jan 2016 03:58:57 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11632640.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11625594</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/jeremy+renner+finalizes+divorce+from+pitt+meadows+model/11625594/story.html</link><title>Jeremy Renner finalizes divorce from Pitt Meadows model Sonni Pacheco</title><description>Jeremy Renner's divorce from B.C.'s Sonni Pacheco has been finalized.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sat, 02 Jan 2016 01:59:04 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11625600.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11608350</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/news/vancouver/christmas+vacation+ages+vancouver+actor+small+role/11608350/story.html</link><title>A Christmas Vacation for the ages: Vancouver actor's small role in National Lampoon movie is still paying off — 26 years later</title><description>Twenty-six years ago, it took two days of work and 21 seconds of screen time for Keith MacKechnie to earn a spot &#8212; albeit an admittedly small one &#8212; in the holiday traditions of millions. In a pivotal scene in the 1989 film National Lampoon&#8217;s Christmas Vacation, MacKechnie knocks on the Griswold family household&#8217;s front door and delivers three lines and one envelope to Chevy Chase, who then shuts the door in his face.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Wed, 23 Dec 2015 16:12:08 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11608353.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11605460</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/first+nations+actor+from+vancouver+island+plays/11605460/story.html</link><title>First Nations actor from Vancouver Island plays key role alongside DiCaprio in The Revenant</title><description>After a year away from acting, he was coaxed back into it by friends who told him -- on three different occasions -- that a big Hollywood production was looking for indigenous actors. In particular, one was needed for a pivotal role.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Tue, 22 Dec 2015 00:11:12 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11605461.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11055787</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movies/pitch+perfect+review+bellas+ball/11055787/story.html</link><title>Pitch Perfect 2 review: Bellas ball</title><description>Much like its motley crew of outliers, the film's spirit of accessibility is right on key</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Fri, 15 May 2015 20:19:25 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11055789.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Pitch Perfect 2 review: Bellas ball" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/arts/movies/pitch-perfect-2-review-bellas-ball" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=11055616</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movies/fury+road+reviewed+waaaaay+beyond+thunderdome/11055616/story.html</link><title>Mad Max: Fury Road, reviewed: Waaaaay beyond Thunderdome</title><description>As a rule the louder a film screams at you the less it has to say &#8212; see Terminator Salvation or any Transformers movie &#8212; but Fury Road has some heart to go with all that blood</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sat, 16 May 2015 14:40:33 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/11055617.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Mad Max: Fury Road, reviewed: Waaaaay beyond Thunderdome" href="http://news.nationalpost.com/arts/movies/mad-max-fury-road-review-waaaaay-beyond-thunderdome" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10857978</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/vancouver+fest+future+broadcast/10857978/story.html</link><title>Vancouver Web Fest is the future of broadcast</title><description>When the plan for the Vancouver Web Fest (VWF) was announced a few years back, founder Suzette Laqua joined a small group of like-minded organizers looking to support and promote programming made specifically for the web.Vancouver Web Fest When: March 6-8</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Tue, 10 Mar 2015 21:18:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10857979.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10778404</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/american+sniper+shoots+down+super+bowl+weekend+boxoffice/10778404/story.html</link><title>'American Sniper' shoots down Super Bowl weekend box-office record with $31.9 million</title><description>NEW YORK, N.Y. - "American Sniper" shot down another box-office record: Its $31.9 million is the biggest Super Bowl weekend gross ever.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sun, 01 Feb 2015 19:20:03 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10778470.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10755187</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/sparking+change+hollywood+annual+visual+effects/10755187/story.html</link><title>Sparking a change in Hollywood: Annual visual effects festival focuses on burgeoning world of virtual reality</title><description>Director Christopher Nolan&#8217;s film Interstellar is a multiple Academy Award-nominee at this year&#8217;s Oscars and a very likely winner in the Best Visual Effects category. When he comes to this week&#8217;s SPARK (FWD) 2015 annual visual effects festival and conference in Vancouver, Ian Hunter of New Deal Studios will discuss bringing Nolan&#8217;s unique visions to the silver screen.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sat, 24 Jan 2015 11:32:53 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10755188.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10752549</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/professor+robert+bridson+takes+home+tech+oscar/10752549/story.html</link><title>UBC professor takes home a Sci-Tech Oscar for work in visual effects</title><description>Robert Bridson&#8217;s face hasn&#8217;t graced the silver screen, but the Vancouver man is taking home an Oscar in February. Bridson will be honoured for his pioneering work in visual effects at the Scientific and Technical Academy Awards, dubbed the Sci-Tech Oscars, on Feb. 7 in Los Angeles.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Fri, 23 Jan 2015 04:12:27 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10752550.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10679053</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/interview+wont+released+canada+christmas+sony/10679053/story.html</link><title>Vancouver-shot 'The Interview' won't be released in Canada on Christmas Day: Sony</title><description>TORONTO - Sony Pictures Entertainment says the controversial comedy "The Interview" will not be released in Canadian theatres on Christmas Day.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Wed, 24 Dec 2014 19:48:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10678980.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10667604</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/year+interview+seemed+seemed+like+good+idea/10667604/story.html</link><title>A year ago The Interview seemed like a good idea</title><description>They made a comedy about cancer (50/50) and scored a hit. Then they made a comedy about the apocalypse (This Is the End) and turned that into a hit as well. And as the now-shelved assassination comedy The interview was being filmed last year in B.C., everyone involved was thinking Seth Rogen and co-director Evan Goldberg had another hit on their hands.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sun, 21 Dec 2014 19:17:10 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10667605.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10447801</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/just+some+fromer+santa+star+real+standup/10447801/story.html</link><title>Just some UBC kid: Former Bad Santa star a real standup guy</title><description>Santa, on why his beard fell off: "I loved a woman who wasn't clean."</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sun, 07 Dec 2014 19:06:53 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10448141.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10480820</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/shortest+short+film+celebration+features+plenty/10480820/story.html</link><title>The Shortest Day Short Film Celebration features plenty of family-friendly movies</title><description>A great way to combat the frenetic festival that is Christmas is to put your wallet away and step back and slow down. The hullabaloo aside, a quieter form of entertainment can be found thanks to the The Shortest Day Short Film Celebration, which will be held at various locations across the country Dec. 19-21.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Mon, 15 Dec 2014 21:51:49 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10480821.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10382054</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/south+surrey+rialto+theatre+reopens+quietly/10382054/story.html</link><title>South Surrey's Rialto Theatre reopens quietly, but its 35mm projector is on its final reel</title><description>Theatre-goers on the Surrey peninsula can once again catch a flick at the iconic Rialto Twin Theatre as the cinema recently re-opened its doors.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Fri, 14 Nov 2014 23:48:40 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10382056.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10349267</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/anthony+hopkins+liotta+begin+filming+with+okanagan/10349267/story.html</link><title>Anthony Hopkins, Ray Liotta set to begin filming Go With Me in the Okanagan</title><description>KELOWNA &#8212; Some of Hollywood&#8217;s biggest stars will descend on British Columbia&#8217;s North Okanagan next week as filming for the feature film &#8220;Go With Me&#8221; begins.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Mon, 03 Nov 2014 20:01:12 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10349280.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10325479</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/soska+sisters+stars+homegrown+horror+scene/10325479/story.html</link><title>Soska sisters stars of homegrown horror scene</title><description>A fan stops abruptly on the North Vancouver sidewalk when she spots her movie idols sitting right in front of her. &#8220;You&#8217;re the ones who did American Mary, aren&#8217;t you?&#8221;</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Mon, 27 Oct 2014 18:20:44 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10326919.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10301771</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/couple+love+affair+with+blues+gets+classic/10301771/story.html</link><title>Couple's love affair with Bye Bye Blues gets classic Canadian film out of copyright limbo</title><description>The love story between a law professor and an actor has saved a classic Canadian film from copyright oblivion &#8212; and could help to rescue more buried cinema treasures.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sat, 18 Oct 2014 16:47:23 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10301775.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10301919</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/bethune+director+former+wife+bids+bring+movie/10301919/story.html</link><title>Bethune director’s former wife bids to bring movie masterpiece back from copyright limbo</title><description>&#8220;I don&#8217;t like talking about Bethune very much,&#8221; Beret Borsos said with a soft, rueful laugh. Borsos was with her husband, the late director Phillip Borsos, in 1987 when they and actor Donald Sutherland headed into the remote Chinese mountains with a small crew of Chinese and Canadians to film their passion project.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sat, 18 Oct 2014 16:37:11 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10301920.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10282353</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/vancouver+international+film+festival+2014/10282353/story.html</link><title>The winners of the 2014 Vancouver International Film Festival</title><description>A look at the winners at 33rd annual Vancouver International Film Festival:</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sat, 11 Oct 2014 07:12:35 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10243800.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10246033</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/violent+poetic+beautiful+tale+tragedy/10246033/story.html</link><title>Violent a poetic and beautiful tale of tragedy</title><description>Andrew Huculiak is the drummer for B.C. indie band We Are the City. He is also the first-time director behind the Norwegian/Canadian co-production feature film Violent.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Mon, 29 Sep 2014 19:47:23 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10246034.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10222300</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/neighbour+murderer+movie+inspiration/10222300/story.html</link><title>His neighbour was a murderer; now he’s his movie inspiration</title><description>Jason Bourque was 13 when he found out there was a killer living down the road from his rural New Brunswick home. Now just over 40, with a successful career writing and directing quickie TV disaster movies in Vancouver, Bourque has never forgotten that mysterious neighbour.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Sun, 21 Sep 2014 05:36:25 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10222301.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10172335</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/viff+opener+packs+some+star+power+with+reese/10172335/story.html</link><title>VIFF opener packs some star power with Reese Witherspoon and Laura Dern</title><description>The 33rd edition of the Vancouver International Film Festival opens with a shot of star power this year, the opening-gala screening of Wild, starring Reese Witherspoon and Laura Dern in the based-on-fact story of a self-destructive woman (Witherspoon) who attempts a 1,000-mile hike along the Pacific Crest Trail. The film is directed by Canada&#8217;s Jean-Marc Vall&#233;e, who last year steered actors Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto to best actor and best supporting actor Oscars in Dallas Buyers Club.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 04 Sep 2014 15:30:28 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10172336.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10172337</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/films+viff+feature+healthy+dose+homegrown/10172337/story.html</link><title>B.C. films at VIFF feature healthy dose of homegrown talent</title><description>VIFF&#8217;s B.C. Spotlight includes 14 titles, a healthy dose of homegrown talent amid the international fare.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 04 Sep 2014 15:29:49 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10172338.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10021872</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/business/locations+where+hollywood+crews+love+make+their+movies/10021872/story.html</link><title>Top 10 locations in B.C. where Hollywood crews love to make their movies</title><description>Location manager Catou Kearney&#8217;s scouts scoured B.C. for three months to find the right forest for Dawn of the Planet of the Apes. Kearney, shooting location manager for the sci-fi blockbuster that opened Friday, knew exactly what she needed.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Mon, 14 Jul 2014 23:39:22 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10021874.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=10021775</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/movie+review+dawn+planet+apes+chilling+parable/10021775/story.html</link><title>Movie review: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes is a chilling parable</title><description>Dawn of the Planet of the Apes 4 stars out of 5 Starring: Andy Serkis, Gary Oldman, Keri Russell, Jason Clarke, Kodi Smit-McPhee Directed by: Matt Reeves Running time: 130 minutes The best scene in the movie is brief, violent [&#8230;]</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 17 Jul 2014 16:38:05 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/10017829.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=9932975</guid><link>http://www.theprovince.com/entertainment/movie-guide/review+jump+street+leaps+right+conclusions/9932975/story.html</link><title>Review: 22 Jump Street leaps to right conclusions (with video)</title><description>Back in the day when 21 Jump Street was earnestly trying to convince us cops could pass as high school students, the spoof movie was synonymous with Leslie Nielsen and slightly naughty sexual double-entendres.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 12 Jun 2014 21:34:18 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/9932976.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.theprovince.com:content=9930177</guid><link>http://www.vancouverdesi.com/news/controversial-film-punjab-1984-celebrates-its-global-launch-in-surrey-w-photos-video/759192/</link><title>Controversial film Punjab 1984 celebrates its global launch in Surrey (w/ photos, video)</title><description>The highly anticipated Punjabi film, Punjab 1984 &#8212; based on events surrounding the Indian government&#8217;s brutal military attack on the state&#8217;s Golden Temple 30 years ago &#8212; celebrated its global launch in Surrey on Wednesday.</description><source>Movies - Top Stories</source><pubDate>Thu, 12 Jun 2014 17:52:14 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.theprovince.com/cms/binary/9930178.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item></channel></rss>
